# UIUserInterfaceIdiom.vision

**Case**

An interface designed for visionOS and Apple Vision Pro.

## Declaration

```swift
case vision
```

## Discussion

If your app has existing code that runs in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserInterfaceIdiom/pad] idiom, you might want to reuse the same code in the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserInterfaceIdiom/vision] idiom. The following code shows how to check for these idioms:

```swift
if idiom == .pad || idiom == .vision {
   // Code to run in the iPad or Apple Vision Pro idioms.
} else { 
   // Code to run in other idioms.
}
```

## Idioms

- **UIUserInterfaceIdiom.unspecified**: An unspecified idiom.
- **UIUserInterfaceIdiom.phone**: An interface designed for iPhone and iPod touch.
- **UIUserInterfaceIdiom.pad**: An interface designed for iPad.
- **UIUserInterfaceIdiom.tv**: An interface designed for tvOS and Apple TV.
- **UIUserInterfaceIdiom.carPlay**: An interface designed for an in-car experience.
- **UIUserInterfaceIdiom.mac**: An interface designed for the Mac.
